div.p: Matthew Parker's manuscript collection naturally reflects his interest in Reformation theology and theologians and the religious debates which took place in the sixteenth century. MS 109 is one of the compilations of tracts and letters Parker assembled from his collection. The volume consists of letters written to Matthew Parker and tracts on issues such as clerical marriage, the sacraments and monastic vows. The volume also contains a copy of 'Against the opinions of the Germans' by Henry VIII. The manuscript dates to the sixteenth century.
